newsitem.title: USA: Spyglass sees revenue low point behind it.
newsitem.headline: Spyglass sees revenue low point behind it.

text.p: Spyglass Inc, which reported what it called "disappointing" fiscal third quarter results on Wednesday, said the low point in revenues is likely behind the company.

"Spyglass is now well on its way to replacing legacy business with device business, and we should now be past our low point as far as revenues are concerned," Doug Colbeth, president and chief executive of Spyglass, told analysts on a conference call.

Last October, Spyglass announced plans to move into the "device market", connecting everyday, non-personal computer devices using Internet technology. It previously supplied World Wide Web desktop browser technology.

On Wednesday, the company reported a loss of $0.45 a share for its third quarter ended June 30, on revenues of $2.2 million. The loss included a $600,000 write-off of receivables, and the company said it decided against recording tax benefits of $1.9 million.
In third quarter 1996, the company reported earnings of $0.07 a share on revenues of $6 million.
